messages.subject: Sword?
messages.msgSnippet: I posted a message about a sword I ve had for years a few weeks ago.  I have finally taken some pictures.  They are in the photo gallery of this group under
messages.messageBody:
I posted a message about a sword I've had for years a few weeks
ago. I have finally taken some pictures. They are in the photo
gallery of this group under "Closet Find". I would appreciate any
information. And thanks again for your help.

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Sword?
messages.msgSnippet: Absolutely do not clean the tang !  The nakago doesn t have to be signed to give you information, but it does have to be as found. Bob ... -- Robert J.
messages.messageBody:
Absolutely do not "clean the tang"! The nakago doesn't have to be
signed to give you information, but it does have to be "as found."

Bob

Bryane wrote:
> Thanks for all the help. I will post pics as soon as possible. I
> live on the east coast of North Carolina (Cape Lookout, Cape
> Hatteras). Would anyone happen to know a reliable source nearby who
> could look at it in hand.
> Some one asked me if I could take the handle off. I have and there
> are no markings anywhere that "I" can see. I haven't cleaned the
> tang so there may be something I'm not seeing. Only light file
> marks that have faded quite considerably if not gone altogether.
> Thanks again for the help.
>
>
>

messages.subject: Sword?
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks for all the help. I will post pics as soon as possible.  I live on the east coast of North Carolina (Cape Lookout, Cape Hatteras). Would anyone happen
messages.messageBody:
Thanks for all the help. I will post pics as soon as possible. I
live on the east coast of North Carolina (Cape Lookout, Cape
Hatteras). Would anyone happen to know a reliable source nearby who
could look at it in hand.
Some one asked me if I could take the handle off. I have and there
are no markings anywhere that "I" can see. I haven't cleaned the
tang so there may be something I'm not seeing. Only light file
marks that have faded quite considerably if not gone altogether.
Thanks again for the help.
